DOC.brief_summary: Objectives: Evaluation of the clinical long-term safety, tolerability, patient satisfaction, pharmacokinetics and pattern of use of oral prucalopride tablets given in doses up to 4 mg once daily to patients with chronic constipation
DOC.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Long-Term Tolerability and Safety of Oral Prucalopride in Chronic Constipation
DOC.criteria: 1. Male or nonpregnant, nonbreastfeeding female outpatients of at least 18 years of age 2. Patient had completed the entire treatment period of the PRUINT6 study or the PRUINT12 study . 1. Patients with impaired renal function 2. Patients with clinically significant abnormalities of haematology, urinalysis, or blood chemistry. 3. Females of childbearing potential without adequate contraceptive protection during the study.
